Mckenzie
I've been visiting Disney since I was baby (thanks mom + dad!) but
my very best trips, the most memorable ones, all took place over the
past four years. The first trip with my oldest daughter Alba Grace in
my belly, the first time she met her beloved Daisy Duck, getting to
bring sister Millie along with us. The best. Watching my girls hug
their favorite princesses in their ice cream covered smocked
dresses... those memories are priceless. I've visited the parks
hundreds of times, but the days spent at Disney with my littles are
the days I've always dreamed of! Our family loves to make memories
at Walt Disney World and I hope that within these pages you'll find
tips that will help you make wonderful memories of your own! 
Hi There!

ABOUT ME
McKenzie is a wife, mother, and life-long
Disney lover with a passion for sharing
helpful tips and tricks to make your Walt
Disney World trip amazing!

CHAPTER ONE
KNOW BEFORE YOU GO
In this chapter I'll share my three golden rules for
Walt Disney World trips with littles and how our
travel mindset makes every trip special!

chapter 1
So you want to take your little ones to Disney? Maybe you're planning your
very first trip or maybe you'd consider yourself a WDW pro. Either way,
successful adventures with kiddos require both planning AND patience. Most
importantly, they require realistic expectations. Which means that you've got
to prioritize. 
I'm sorry to be the one to tell you this, but if you want to have a great Disney
trip with kids, you're not going to be able to tackle everything on your
wishlist. Coming to terms with this reality (before you drive under the
magical Mickey gates!) is truly the best way to enjoy a stress-free vacation.
You're likely not going to ride every rollercoaster in the Magic Kingdom or
catch every show, but I promise your trip will be one for the books!
 
Gather up your family and dream together. List your top three attraction
priorities for each day of your trip (rides) then your top two experiences (ex:
catching a Magic Kingdom parade + meeting Minnie Mouse) and one dining
reservation you'd love to score. Once you've got your list of must-do's each
day, jot down a few other adventures you'd love to squeeze in. If those things
don't happen, that's okay. If they do, it's a major win! Setting the bar low
makes planning your days so much more manageable and leaves room for the
unexpected Disney magic you'll find around every corner of the parks! 
 
Prioritize

I've heard it said that your family is only as old as your youngest child,
so we take that into consideration on all of our trips. We move at a
toddler pace on most of our park days and in my opinion, it's the best
way to do Disney! We try our very best not to overplan and to let the
littles lead. Taking it slow means fewer meltdowns and more room for
unexpected magic. 
 
Friends, I'm here to tell you that there is no meltdown like a sweaty,
sugary, Disney meltdown! So let's avoid those. Okay?! 
chapter 1
Take It Slow

chapter 1
I know my type A readers are cringing at the title
of this page but this pep talk is for you so stay
put! Things won't always go your way at Disney
so flexibility is #important. 
Florida weather is unpredictable, regardless of what the
forecast shows you. Rides break down (sometimes when
you're on them.) Toddlers decide to boycott public restrooms
(speaking from recent experience here!) and sometimes we
forget to pack essentials. Things go wrong. Flexibility is the
name of the game at Disney. Plans will need to be tweaked
and changed throughout the day according to wait times and
nap schedules. As our girl Elsa likes to say, "Let it
gooooooooo", roll with the punches and make the most of it.
Put a smile on your face and treat yo' self to a dole whip or
two! You're at Disney after all! :) 
 
Be Flexible

Golden Rule #1
Prioritize!
Golden Rule #2
Take It Slow!
Golden Rule #3
Be Flexible! 

“Happiness is a state of mind. It’s just according to
the way you look at things." 
- Walt Disney

CHAPTER TWO
GETTING STARTED
Now that we're all on the same page with our
travel philosophy, let's get to work!
Researching, dreaming and planning for your
Disney trip is part of the fun! 

For those new to the world of Disney, research is your first step. If you've
purchased this e-book I can already tell that you'll love this phase of planning
your Disney vacation. This is the part where you dream up the type of Disney
trip you'd like to have and get your family excited about what's to come.
chapter 2
Research
A few of my favorite sources for research:
 
Websites & Youtube: Disney Food Blog + All Ears
Youtube Search Words: Disney Vlog, WDW Resort Tour, WDW Room Tour,
WDW Rides, WDW Tips
Facebook Groups: Disney With Littles, Smart Moms Planning Disney, Taking
Tots To Disney, TBBC Mama's Planning Disney
 
 

chapter 2
Did you know that you can hire a Disney planner to
help with your trip for free?! Yep! They are paid by
Disney, so hiring one will only SAVE you money!
Hiring a Disney planner can be a huge help, even for Disney pros like myself!
Planners will do the "dirty work" for you so that you can focus on your family
while on vacation. They'll wake up early to book your dining reservations, stay on
top of promotions and deals Disney launches during the planning process, and
help you maximize your time in the parks! The really  good ones will also make
themselves available to answer your questions and help with any hiccups you may
encounter during your Disney stay. Travel agents are in the know when it comes
to changes in park policies and health info so you'll always be in the loop.
Hiring a Planner
Need a recommendation? 
 
Mary Helen Law, Mouse Counselor, IG @maryhelen_mousecounselor
Courtney Callicutt, Mouse Counselor IG @courtneyc_mousecounselor
Natalie Alfant, Mouse Counselor IG @nataliealfant_mousecounselor

If you're asking, "how far out can I start planning my trip" then today is as good
as any! There's no harm in starting the research process more than a year out,
but the sweet spot for booking is 6-12 months out. Many of our trips are planned
in just a few months and sometimes we're even more spontaneous than that.
Perks of being just a few hours down the road I suppose!
 
And now to answer the burning question... when's the best time visit?!
The answer is different for every family but you'll want to pay close attention to
crowd levels (check out magicguides.com), weather (summer is HOT!) as well as
festivals & after hours events your family may be interested in. Visiting while
school is still in session (avoiding school holidays) is always a good idea!

CHAPTER THREE
WHERE TO STAY
There's so much to consider when it comes to
Disney resorts. But this is a guide to stress-free
Disney trips with littles so we'll use that for our
ranking order!

disney resort
perks:
on-site transportation is a
huge convenience with littles
in tow!
early park entry
 (30 minutes sooner than other
guests!)
7am lightning lane access
book dining reservations 70
days out

Monorail resorts make mid-day Magic Kingdom naps possible. Some of these
resorts are close enough that you can even walk to the Magic Kingdom! Five star
fireworks views, the best dining on property and all of the deluxe resort
amenities you can dream up. The monorail resorts are the most convenient
choice for a Disney vacay with young kids. But be warned, they'll come with the
heftiest price tag. 
 
The Grand Floridian, The Polynesian & The Contemporary are Disney's
monorail resorts. My favorite is the Grand Floridian. (Regardless of where you
stay, you must visit the Grand Floridian lobby on your trip to hear the lobby
pianist.) The monorail runs to these three resorts as well as to Epcot & Magic
Kingdom! We love the monorail because you DO NOT have to fold your stroller
unlike Disney busses. 
chapter 3
Monorail Resorts

If a monorail resort isn't for you, consider a Skyliner resort. Disney's
open-air skyliner system can transport you from The Riviera (Deluxe
Resort), Carribean Beach (Moderate Resort), Pop Century (Value
Resort), & Art of Animation (Value Resort) to Hollywood Studios or
Epcot!
 
My favorite skyliner resorts are The Riviera & Art of Animation (check
out the family suites!) Pop Century is a great value resort option, with
recently updated rooms!
 
*Note: You will have to fold your double stroller up on the skyliner so do
take that into consideration. Single strollers can remain open.
chapter 3
Skyliner Resorts

Swan & Dolphin: 
 
Epcot is our family favorite and we're Marriott Cardholders so the Swan &
Dolphin (the only Marriott owned Disney property) are a no-brainer for us. Epcot
area resorts are worth considering if your family is planning an Epcot day
because you can walk or take a quick boat ride over. *The Boardwalk, Beach Club
& Yacht Club are in the Epcot bubble and also worth considering if this sounds
appealing!
 
chapter 3
Honorable Mentions
Old Key West: 
 
OKW is a DVC (Disney Vacation Club) property (which means you can rent points
to save $$$ - check out MouseSavers.com) our family loves the slow laid back vibe,
HUGE rooms, many pools, on-site dining & water taxi to Disney Springs!
 

disney
transportation
BUS SYSTEM
 
Disney's most used (and most unreliable) mode of
transportation. The busses are convenient in that you don't
have to drive but you will have to to plan for possible
delays and the inconvenience of folding up your stroller! 
MONORAIL
 
My favorite way to get around! The monorail will take
you to Magic Kingdom Ticket & Transportation as well
as to all three of the monorail resorts. You can also hop
on the monorail to switch between Epcot & The Magic
Kingdom. Typically very reliable but I did recently get
stuck on the monorail for 45 minutes so you really never
know!
 
 
 
 
 
 
SKYLINER
 
This open-air gondola system conveniently connects
Disney's Hollywood Studios and International
Gateway at Epcot to the following Resort hotels:
Disney's Caribbean Beach Resort, Disney's Art of
Animation Resort, Disney's Pop Century Resort and
Disney's Riviera Resort.
*Don't want to rely on Disney's free transportation services?
Consider driving your own car or using Uber, Lyft, or Disney's
own Minnie Van service! 

airport
transportation
MEARS CONNECT
 
Standard riders could be the first or last stop so it's
not confirmed how long your ride will be. Minimal
wait for express. $91-$250 (standard vs express)
 
SUNSHINE FLYER
 
Great affordable ($93) option for a larger family.
Keep in mind that it could take up to 65 minutes
before you arrive at your stop. You'll love the magical
theming!
UBER, LYFT OR MINNIE VANS
 
The cost for an SUV with car seat is around $207. In a
standard lyft or uber Car seat options cannot be
booked ahead of time so you'll want to book a Minnie
Van if carseats are necessary just to be safe.
PRIVATE CAR SERVICES
 
The only option with no wait! Cost is approximately
$250. HappyLimo comes highly recommended! With
this option you can add carseats or boosters.

“They say if you dream a thing more than once,
it’s sure to come true” – Sleeping Beauty
 

CHAPTER FOUR
DISNEY DINING
In my opinion, the best part of any vacation is the food!
Mickey shaped food tastes even better. You might be
surprised to learn that Disney World dining isn't all hot
dogs and plastic cheese! There's a little somethin' for
everyone, even the most adventurous eaters!

Character dining is a Disney must. An easy way to "kill two birds with one
stone", knocking out a meal AND hanging out with characters at the same time.
You'll have a unique character experience your littles are sure to remember! In
my opinion, character dining is one of the best parts of a Disney vacation. I'd
recommend you book at least one during your visit. 
 
Breakfast at Topolino's Terrace is our family favorite character experience! 
 Reservations for this one can be harder to snag but it's well worth stalking the
Disney website & signing up for Mouse Dining alerts for. 
 
You can find character dining experiences in several resorts and in each of the
Disney World parks. You'll find different characters and unique theming at
each restaurant.
chapter 4
Character Dining

There are hundreds of in-park dining options
ranging from snack kiosks and quick service
restaurants to sit down dining experiences fit for
even the biggest foodies. I like having a reservation
for one sit down restaurant each day (especially in
the Magic Kingdom where quick service options
aren't the tastiest.
chapter 4
In-Park Dining

chapter 4
In-Park Dining
RESERVATIONS TO SNAG!
 
MAGIC KINGDOM
 
Be Our Guest (character dining), Crystal Palace (buffet and previously character
dining), Skippers Canteen (delicious options for adventurous eaters,  hilarious staff
and most impressive kids menu!), Cinderella's Royal Table
 
ANIMAL KINGDOM
 
Yak & Yeti (one of my favorite restaurants on property!), Tusker House (character
dining!) and Rain Forest Cafe for more adventurous littles! Tiffins is a TREAT but not
the most kid-friendly option.
 
HOLLYWOOD STUDIOS
 
Hollywood Brown Derby (order the Cobb salad and thank me later!), Hollywood & Vine
(underwhelming food but the littles will ADORE the character interactions!) and Tune
In Lounge. Oh wait, that last one's not a restaurant but we can't visit HS without
popping in for drinks and AC!
 
EPCOT
 
We are team #snackaroundtheworld in Epcot but have also tried many of the
restaurants. Our favorites have been Tutto Italia (decent food, better wine list!) and
anything in Mexico! You really can't go wrong eating in any of the countries!

(buff

Finding a resort that has on-site dining options you love is always a win
but don't forget that you can make reservations to dine at any Disney
resort! It's a fun way to explore the property and scope out your next
resort destination. 
 
Favorite Resort Dining:
 
Citricos at The Grand Floridian
Flying Fish at The Boardwalk
Beaches & Cream at The Beach Club
Olivia's at Old Key West
Steakhouse 71 at The Contemporary
 
chapter 4
Resort Dining

With plenty of magical shops to explore, live music, tons of dining
options and even a few kid-friendly rides like a train & carousel, Disney
Springs is always a hit with our girls! Definitely worth scheduling an
evening at Disney Springs on your next trip.
 
Disney Springs Favorites:
 
The Boathouse
Homecomin' 
D Luxe Burger
Giddeon's Bakeshop
 
chapter 4
Disney Springs Dining

chapter 4
Dining Reservations
Resort guests can make dining reservations 70 days out. If you don't see
a reservation for a specific spot right away, do not fear! I'll share my
favorite hack with you! 
 
I've scored all of our best dining reservations using the Mouse Dining
website (www.mousedining.com) to sign up for alerts. I suggest using the
paid membership option so that you can add multiple phone numbers to
the alerts! The system works by triggering text messages when a dining
reservation is dropped so you'll need to act fast when you get the text!
 
Still haven't scored a reservation by your park day? Once in the parks,
you can join walk up lists for restaurants that have availability!  Keep
an eye on the dining reservations tab of the app throughout the day. 
 
 

chapter 4
Snacking & Groceries
Snacks are part of the Disney experience! We don't overdo it with the dining reservations so
that we can overindulge in Mickey pretzels and popcorn throughout our day. My favorite
WDW snacks are the Cat Tail from Cheshire Cafe in the Magic Kingdom, Corn & Pork Tacos
from the Margarita Stand in Epcot's Mexico pavilion, Macarons from Epcot's France pavilion,
egg rolls from Epcot's China pavilion and churros from any kiosk offering them! :)
 
Disney Food Blog has some of the best up-to-date guides for snacking in the parks, you can
even print their guide to take with you! 
 
Epcot is the most exciting park for snacking, especially during a festival! You can enjoy small
bites from around the world while taking in some of the prettiest spots in WDW! 
 
You can bring your own snacks and drinks into the parks as well. We packs tons of snacks to
keep the littles in good spirit all day long! Disney even allows cooler bags as long as there is no
loose ice. 
 
We like to bring groceries to our room to save on drinks, snacks and breakfast! Sign up for
Instacart and have your groceries delivered straight to your room before check-in.

CHAPTER FIVE
PLANNING YOUR DAYS
Refer back to our perfect formula for
stress free Disney days and let's get to
planning!

ticket options
& park hopping
The ticket offerings change frequently
so I don't want to share the specifics
here but instead to fill you in on the
basics.
 
Park Hopper tickets give you an
option to visit more than one park in
a day. Park hopping is such a
personal decision so you'll want to
weigh the pros and cons for your
family. Park hopping can be a bit
more challenging for little ones (lots
of transportation) and it's an added
expense. But if you're only visiting
Disney for a few days, it might be
worth considering! My "stress-free"
tip here: if you're on the fence, don't
do it. There's plenty to experience in
each park and don't forget, you'll be
moving at the pace of your littles!
 

ENTERING THE
PARK
Once you've arrived at the park you'll need to
get through security and then make your way
over to the entrance where you'll scan your
ticket or magic band. 
 
We now have this (sometimes stressful!)
process down to a science so I want to share
how we navigate with two kiddos, bags, and a
stroller.
 
I grab the bags from under the stroller
(typically just our backpack, sometimes a
cooler bag or busy bag and then a bag that
holds our stroller rain cover) and make my
way through the individual security gate
while my husband pushes the girls through the
stroller lane. We let the girls know in advance
that they MUST stay in the stroller during
this process! Sometimes Disney security will
want to further search our bags and
sometimes they won't. Being prepared with
bags in hand + unzipped if necessary helps
the process run smoothly!
 
 

The My Disney Experience app is your new best friend! Spend time getting to know
it before your trip! When visiting with kiddos these features will be the most helpful
to understand:
 
*How to use the map feature to view wait times, find baby care centers, restrooms,
nearby dining, character experiences and entertainment opportunities. 
 
*Using the mobile food order feature to order ahead quick service food before
arriving at the kiosk
 
*Check Daily park hours and closed attractions
 
*Use the resort hotel feature to check-in, explore resort amenities and even unlock
the door to your room!
 
 
 
chapter 5
Know The App

Disney Genie is the complimentary offering that is now available to all guests visiting Walt Disney World. Walt Disney
World guests will access the tool within the existing My Disney Experience app at Walt Disney World and Disneyland
guests will use the Disneyland app to access Disney Genie.
 
Disney Genie provides a real-time Tip Board with customized recommendations for experiences, wait times and next
showtimes, and Lightning Lane return times; restaurant waitlist, check-in and reservations; mobile order; and access to
attraction virtual queues (currently available for Remy’s Ratatouille Adventure).
 
Ahead of or on the day of their visit, guests can input their “Top Picks” for attractions, entertainment and dining, as well
as their park-hopping plans, and Disney Genie will generate a recommended itinerary based on these selections.
 
Pro tip: Disney Genie recommendations are just that — suggestions. If Genie adds something to your itinerary that you’re
not interested in doing, you can remove it and Genie will re-optimize your day with new recommendations. Within
Disney Genie, guests have the option to purchase Disney Genie+, a paid add-on that enables guests to bypass the standby
queue and instead use the Lightning Lane (previously the FastPass entry) for most attractions. The cost is $15 plus tax per
person, per day at Walt Disney World and $20 plus tax per person per day at Disneyland, where Disney Genie+ also
includes free Disney PhotoPass downloads.
 
Once purchased for the day, Disney Genie+ can be used in all parks by guests with park hopper tickets at no additional
cost. Disney Genie+ gives guests Lightning Lane access to special attractions!
 
 
chapter 5
Genie +

As part of the Disney Genie service, guests to Walt
Disney World now have two ways to access
Lightning Lanes (the newest version of Fastpass).
Those are the daily Genie+ service, or by
purchasing Individual Lighting Lane access for
specific attractions.
 
 
chapter 5
Lightning Lane

LIGHTNING LANE
TIPS
For Genie+, you want to have completed your
purchase before you try to make your first
booking. To purchase, you can buy through the My
Disney Experience app starting at midnight.
At 7 a.m., everyone is able to start making their
first Genie+ reservation, and guests staying at
select Walt Disney World resort hotels can begin
making Individual Lightning Lane reservations.
So, to have the best selection, you will want to
start as close to 7 a.m. as possible.
 
Make additional selections as soon as possible. If
your Genie+ selections are more than 2 hours in
the future, pay attention to the exact time your
initial selection was made, and be ready on the
app to make another selection 2 hours later. If
your selection is inside that 2 hour line, you can
make a new selection as soon as your final entry
scan is complete, so keep an eye on whether that is
one or two touchpoints for the attraction you are
entering.
 

LIGHTNING LANE
TIPS
For those who are booking Lightning Lane
reservations later in the day, you can
also “stack” reservations close to each
other. This will allow you to experience
numerous attractions in quick succession.
You’ll just want to make sure you give
yourself enough time to both experience
the attractions and travel to the next.
*Be sure to watch a youtube video on
"stacking" to hear strategy from the pros! 
Guests are also able to book a Lightning
Lane reservation for a park that they
have not yet park hopped to. So, if you
are planning on hopping, you can make
a reservation before you begin your
travel to save time upon arrival.

While I think you can have a great day at Disney
without a single ride, the attractions are part of the
fun! Not sure what attractions your kiddos will like?
You can watch YouTube videos of the attractions prior
to your trip to get a feel for their interests! You never
know what your littles will enjoy and we're always
surprised by what our girls like and don't like.
Preparation and research is key! 
chapter 5
Attractions

One of the best things about Disney with littles is
that they're not quite tall enough for all of the thrill
rides, leaving more time for experiences like
parades, shows, character meet & greets and
fireworks! These are some of the most special and
memorable moments at Disney World!
chapter 5
Experiences

how to find
character meet
& greets
The easiest way to find character meet-and-greets is
the My Disney Experience app. Offering up-to-the-
minute information on where and when characters
will be greeting guests and, depending on the meet-
and-greet, how long it will take to see them. 
 
You can even make a Genie+ reservation to meet
certain characters. However, if you’d rather not be
plugged into your phone all day , you can also look
on the Times Guide or ask a guest relations cast
member. 
 
Meet-and-greets can also happen unannounced at
random times and places. These unexpected
appearances can often be some of the rarer
characters you’ll meet. 
 
If there’s a character you or your kids absolutely
can’t miss, the easiest ways to guarantee it happens
is by booking a Disney character meal, making a
Lightning Lane reservation (if available) or making
sure you’re first in line for their next meet-and-
greet. 
 

character meet
& greet tips
Have your autograph book open and
ready - don't forget a pen or marker!
Watch character meet-and-greet
videos at home so your littles know
what to expect!
Ask questions and engage! Characters
are here to interact, not just post for
photos.
At the end of your experience a cast
member will snap a photo that you
can access in the app! You can also
ask them to use your phone or camera
for a photo. 

parades &
calvalcades
Let's be real. The parades are THE BEST part
of Disney! Grab a Mickey Bar and scout out
your spot at least 30 min in advance! If you're
traveling with family, this is a good time to
split up and let grandma (insert: whoever
wants a break!) scope out the perfect parade
viewing spot for your group.
 
Currently there are two scheduled parades in
the Magic Kingdom, in addition to pop-up
cavalcades (a fun way to see tons of characters!)
in all four parks. These two parades are Disney
Festival of Fantasy (timeless parade with tons
of movie characters!) and Move It! Shake It!
Street Dance Party (Interactive dance party
parade with Mickey & friends!)
 
The easiest way to find the Disney cavalcade &
parade times is in the My Disney Experience
app. The app also gives map locations on where
to find the routes and a quick description of
what happens during each one. These showtimes
are given for all four Walt Disney World parks.

firworks
Fireworks are a hit or miss for little ones. 
My kiddos aren't big fans of loud noises (even
with sound-blocking headphones!) but if
yours are, you'll absolutely LOVE the
fireworks show at Disney! 
 
There are currently two shows - one in Epcot
and one in Magic kingdom. Typically Epcot's
fireworks start after Magic Kingdom's
fireworks. If you're deciding between the two,
I much prefer the show at Magic Kingdom
largely due to the beautiful castle projections!
Check the app for showtimes and 
 
The easiest way to find the Disney cavalcade &
parade times is in the My Disney Experience
app. The app also gives map locations on where
to find the routes and a quick description of
what happens during each one. These showtimes
are given for all four Walt Disney World parks.

your littles love about Disney to LIFE!
 
From interactive training labs and animal
encounters to classic broadway style sing-a-
longs, there is a show for everyone!
 
There are tons of kid-friendly shows in each of
the four parks! Don't skip these. A great way to
get a break in the AC and experience something
completely captivating.

playgrounds
within the parks
MAGIC KINGDOM
 
You'll find four play spaces in Magic Kingdom perfect to let
kids run wild in! Under Spash Mountain, inside the Dumbo
attraction, across from theBarnstormer ride and on Tom
Sawyer's Island! 
EPCOT
 
Epcot has one year-round playground (located next to
Connections Cafe) as well as a seasonal playground during
the Flower & Garden Festival at the front of the world
showcase entrance. This is my kiddos favorite park because
there are so many areas to play within the World Showcase
as well! Raining? There's an indoor play area located inside
Nemo's aquariam!
ANIMAL KINGDOM
 
The boneyard playground in Dinoland is huge! You’ll also
find some interactive play areas throughout the park. Like
a drumming section in Africa and a Drumming Section in
Pandora.
HOLLYWOOD STUDIOS
 
While Hollywood Studios doesn't currently have a
designated playground - we love to let the kids run around
Echo Lake near The 50's Prime Time Cafe!

CHAPTER SIX
PRO TIPS
A quick guide to my Disney tips & tricks you
need to know about! 

Pack your own princess dresses &
costumes to bring out for special
occasions like dinner! 
Stop by Sir Mickey's for a little "pixie
dust" magic! A fun freebie your little one
will love.
Any kiosk with a soda fountain will
gladly provide you with free cups of
water!

Keep a note in your phone with your itinerary,
screenshots of photo spots and details on things
you'd like to do as you're researching! While
you're in the parks keep adding for next trip!
Flattened pennies make for a fun interactive
(and super affordable!) souvenir! Find kiosks
around the parks to collect your favorites. 
Visit the dollar store prior to your trip to fill a
"bag of tricks" up with small prizes to keep
littles entertained or to let them choose from
when gift shop toys aren't on your radar. 

Invest in a bubble wand! Disney has kindly
replaced ours three times (no guarantee!) and
it provides for endless entertainment! What's
more fun than bubbles?!
While there aren't many "crowd-free" days at
WDW, you can check Disney's crowd calendar
online to find the best possible times to travel!
In the summer we typically avoid midday in
the park! Early morning and early evenings
are great but anytime between 12 and 3 is
miserably hot. This is a great time to head back
to the room for naps or splash in the pool!

Character meals and experiences can be
overwhelming for littles. Limit character meals
to just one per day or per trip!
I always recommend renting or traveling to
Disney with a stroller! Even for older kids. We
LOVE our Zoe Double Luxe stroller for Disney!
Don't forget your stroller tag!
As someone who loves taking photos with my
"nice camera" I rarely bring it into the parks. It's
one less thing to keep up with and the times I
have brought it I've found myself quickly
reaching for my iPhone instead. 

Gift shops after rides are impossible to avoid.
Let kids snap a picture of things they'd like for
Christmas or Birthdays or offer them a small
prize out of your bag of tricks!
The best way to save on your Disney trip is to
hire a planner that can help you stay on track!
You might also choose to stay at a value resort,
if so we love Art of Animation & Pop Century!
Free souvenir idea: stop by guest services for
an "I'm celebrating" or "First Visit" button for
everyone in your party!

Don't skip Epcot with little ones! There are fun
Kidcot stops in each of the countries, tons of
characters and the slower pace is perfect for
toddlers! Ours ADORE the trains in Germany!
Save this for the end of the trip BUT if your
littles seem to have a post-fireworks burst of
energy, the few hours before park close are the
best times to ride #allthethings in Magic
Kingdom!
Mama, always pack a change of clothes! You
never want to say no to a splash pad or
Mickey Bar because you didn't pack
accordingly.

Want to get into a park before the crowds? 
Grab the earliest breakfast reservation available!
If you can't snag a breakfast reservation we
recommend "rope dropping" or arriving 30 min
before park opening!
Invest in a silicone strap attachment for
your stroller. Clip water bottles to said
strap. No more lost water bottles or sippy
cups. Thank me later!
If you're a nursing or pumping mama, I
always preferred to bring a hand pump but
you can nurse or use an electric pump in the
baby care centers! These are also great spots
to change diapers and grab baby essentials!

Worried about your stroller? 
Attach an apple air tag just in case!
Snap a family photo at your resort before
entering the parks, just in case you forget to
grab one while you're there! And while we're
talking photos, the best castle photo spot is to
the right of the castle near Cinderella's well!
Teach your little ones your full name and to
find another mommy or a cast member (help
them understand what a cast member looks
like!) incase they get separated.

"Laughter is timeless, imagination has no age,
and dreams are forever."
- Walt Disney

what to wear
FOR MAMA
 
Within the Disney parks you'll find a little bit of
everything. So if you're comfortable in athleisure, you'll
fit right in. And if you're more comfortable dressing up a
bit, you'll fit right in! I personally prefer to dress up on
our park days. Choosing an outfit that fits the theme of
the park is part of the fun IMO! I rock sneakers in the
winter and Target's sun & sand line sandals in the spring
& summer. My preference is a cute top and shorts or a
dress with biker shorts underneath making it easy to
bend over and chase littles! I typically pair with a big
sunhat or themed Minnie Ears! My girls love when I wear
ears! :) Fanny packs or backpacks are my
recommendation to free up your hands!
FOR LITTLES
 
I love a smocked Disney dress or shorts set! Anything
with a mickey head or character is a hit with my littles
and gets them pumped for the adventure. It's also so
sweet to see them meet the character they're wearing!
We pack princess dresses for special dinners or
nighttime activities but rarely wear them all day
(hello, FL heat!) which makes them even more special.
We take tons of photos while at Disney so making sure
they're in something that's comfy AND cute is part of
the fun! As mentioned, sandals (we love Sun Sans and
Footmates!) are my go-to's at Disney if the weather
permits. Rain happens, and soggy sneakers are the
worst! Be sure to follow along on Instagram for outfit
inspo!
